characters: INT/EXT. TRAIN/TRAIN STATION. AFTERNOON. 6 YEARS EARLIER
DEAN WALKS OUT OF THE TRUCK AND INTO A NEW APARTMENT.
DEAN FINDS A LITTLE BAG INSIDE THE PURSE. SHE SNATCHES IT
A SERIES OF PORTRAITS/DOCUMENTS OF MARRIAGES. REAL PEOPLE
EXT. PERIERA HOME- BACKYARD- PRESENT DAY
CURTIS TIES A BLUE BLANKET AROUND HIM TO SECURE HIS LOAD.
HE SINGS A SONG TO HIMSELF.
ELLIPSE. DEAN TRIES TO GIVE CINDY THE LOCKET. SHE REFUSES
REALLY GETTING MARRIED. WE PLAY WITNESS TO THEM ALL.
INT. MINI VAN. DRIVING. AFTERNOON. PRESENT DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 5-year old girl wearing pajamas wanders alone down the  street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me-gan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANKIE crawls through a dog door. She walks into the liv room where the TV is on loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEAN PERIERA, 30 years old, hefty, sleeps in a lazyboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddydaddydaddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie uses the footrest to crawl up onto her dad's bell

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sniffles. He notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back door opens and Dean carries Frankie to the yard. first yellow rays of sunlight hit their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over the lawn, an empty bowl, water tin and a doghouse posting the name MEGAN. He peeks inside the doghouse. There's no one home. Dean moves to the fence. T gate is open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean carries Frankie to the front yard. They look around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's she going to get back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She probably just went out for a run. She'll be back soon because she's going to get thirsty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's going to be thirsty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what we should do? We should leave her bowl full of water and her dish full of food. Because she's gotta get hungry and thirsty sometime. You know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean's optimism is infectious. Frankie nods slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like me. I'm hungry. I'm so hungry I could eat your toes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean pretends to gnaw at Frankie's toes. Breaks her sadne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CINDY PERIERA, 28, sleeps in bed. Sunlight spills through translucent yellow curtains into a small master bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean sets Frankie down on the bed, motions to her to be silent. He sniffs the air. She follows. They eye each oth and pounce. Cindy wakes up with a gasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sleeping!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're hungry! We're going to eat you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pin her arms above her head and 'furber' her armpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't laugh. Come on, don't laugh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy doesn't laugh, she screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy, nursing a weight-loss drink, scans through digital photos on the computer. We see - family on vacation, Frankie's first day of school, Frankie and a black and wh Border Collie mutt - Megan. Cindy exports the picture whe A tea kettle whistle blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean and Frankie sit at the table. He plays a song for Frankie on a ukulele. Cindy gets up, turns off the kettle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to the flute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy pours the hot water into a bowl with instant oatmea raisins. She blows on the food and places it at the table

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, eat, you can't be late today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie takes a tiny bite and makes a sour face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy turns on the faucet over a pile of dishes, returns the computer to e-mail herself the missing dog flyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here... we can make it taste better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean spoons the raisins out of her bowl onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is how a leopard eats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laps up his coffee like a cat. She mimics. Dean laughs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Frankie, use a spoon. You know how to use a spoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lepers don't use spoons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you gonna listen to your mother? I think you better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie reluctantly takes a tiny bite. Her face sours and lets the food fall out of her mouth and back in the bowl. Cindy returns to the dishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, eat five bites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean gets up, goes to Cindy at the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get a dishwasher...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tries to take the dish sponge away from her. She resists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it. Come on let me do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drops the sponge, dries her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie! We're leaving in 15. Eat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie ignores her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls Frankie out of her seat and carries her under o arm to the back room. Frankie protests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean watches, shakes his head. He sees the computer on, Cindy's e-mail is still open. He shuts off the running wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scans through messages from a bunch of names of people Dean doesn't know. He sweats, clicks open a return messag from a real estate company - apartment now available.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look up for mommy... come on Frankie! We're gonna be late... look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie is propped up on the sink. Cindy draws cat whiske on her cheeks. Frankie tips her head back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CINDY (softens) (cont'd) Don't blink... leopards don't blink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy backs their minivan out of the garage. Frankie is strapped in her carseat. Dean comes up to the window, kno Cindy brakes. Dean hands Frankie her backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEAN (to Frankie) You be good today for Miss Alex, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie, dressed like a little leopard, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEAN (to Frankie) (cont'd) Love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEAN (to Cindy) Love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her on the corner of her mouth. A hesitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean pulls his head out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your seat belt on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. What's the big deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy does as she's told, looks over her shoulder, scrape the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy cranks the wheel straight, puts on the gas and burn down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean stands there in his driveway, muttering to himself. watches the car disappear down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another car, headed the opposite direction, barrels down road, past the Periera home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow that piece of shit down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy clicks the "print" button on a computer, moves to t printer. It spits out a "Missing Dog" flyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. SAM FEINBERG - handsome, well-groomed, unshakable confidence - appears at the door, with coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy places the flyers in her folder in a rush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry...I'm almost done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 5A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a second? Did you get a chance to talk it over with your family yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I'm going to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to tell you, it's a huge opportunity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I know. I should know for sure by Monday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Monday's our day. I want the A team up there with me. Talk it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feinberg walks away down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean drives with a beer in a koozie and a cigarette. He h coughing fit, rolls down his window and spits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLEY - late 30s, hefty, African American - sits in the passenger seat. He pops the top to a Styrofoam coffee cup

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They talk about sex, women and broken fantasies. But Dean attention is on the side of the road, scanning the neighborhood for Megan. He whistles sharp and loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheer up man. God wants you to be happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God's a woman and she's pissed off at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ultrasound monitor, the abstracted image of a 20-week fetus. Cindy watches Feinberg perform an ultrasound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. FEINBERG (to Cindy) Do you want to take over from here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy places her hand on the sensor. Feinberg places his over hers. They gently glide it over the abdomen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. FEINBERG (cont'd) Easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feinberg releases Cindy's hand and removes his latex glov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. FEINBERG (cont'd) Very good, Cindy. You're in good hands. Cindy is one of our favorites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy blushes. She is transfixed on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to know the sex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean smokes, works in the soon to be living room. He pain picture on the wall before covering it up with the roller

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drives through a drive through and orders fast food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy drives, fast food wrapper in hand, sees something o the window. She slows down, waits for opposing traffic to pass, then pulls a wide u-turn. She rises up out of her s to look at something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls the car to a stop, puts on the hazzards, takes moment to compose herself, unbuckles her seatbelt. Gets o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLIPSE: A blanket covers a dead Border Collie mutt in th gutter. Cindy puts Megan's body into the back of her van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOURTH OF JULY music recital. The Pre-K classes are lined on small bleachers. Led by their teacher, the kids sing " A Yankee Doodle Boy."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie, steps out of her line of pre-kindergarteners to if her parents are in the bleachers. She spots her father jumps a little, and wonders if he can see her.    (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 7A. 12 CONTINUED: 12

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean sits alone, picks paint off his hands. He does not f watch the children - he watches the door for Cindy to ent He wonders where she is - every possible scenario passes through his mind. looks at the clock - 3:35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy arrives with haste, purse open, holding a big set o keys in her right hand and a water bottle in her left. Sh props her sunglasses on her head, looks around for Franki She waves to her, but Frankie doesn't see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean spots Cindy by the base of the bleachers - relaxes. picks up his jacket, puts it on his lap, making room for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around for Dean, spots him near the top of the bleachers. Little waves. She climbs the crowded bleachers stopping to talk with parents along the way. She comes up next to Dean, takes her purse off. They say "hi" but neit one makes eye contact. Dean takes the water bottle from h     (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 8. 12 CONTINUED: (2) 12   DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't think you were gonna make it.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I miss her?  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost. Her class is coming up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean kisses her cheek. Cindy settles, arranges her things  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a good day?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was alright... Busy.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything good happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy shakes her head "no." She drops her keys into her purse, but they miss the target and she fumbles after the  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy shakes her head. Takes the water from Dean. He star at her. She concentrates on closing the clasp on her purs  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't want to start crying. Dean gets visibly frustrated. He's sick of prying everything out of her.   DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you gotta make me beg? I know there's something wrong. It's gonna come out eventually. Just tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song ends. A patter of applause. The teacher introduc the next song "THE BATTLE HYMN OF THE REPUBLIC".   CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found Megan.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great, where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy doesn't answer. She can't. She tries to keep from crying. He quickly realizes what she's trying to tell him   (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 8A. 12 CONTINUED: (3) 12   DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over on Urbandale... near Spur.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you you gotta close that fucking gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy wipes tears. She has to look up and blink to keep t from rolling down her cheek. Dean puts his arm around her holds her close. She tries to pull away. He won't let her  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. It's not your fault.     (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 9. 12 CONTINUED: (4) 12

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie sees her Mother and Father huddled together. She  sings louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy sits in her car, checking her eyes in the rear view mirror. They are puffy. Frankie runs full speed into Dean arms. He picks her up and walks her to Cindy's car.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were great.  FRANKIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find Megan?  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But... I was thinking... Maybe she got a job or something... You know? So she could make some money and buy some food. Or maybe she moved out to Hollywood to become a movie dog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie nods. Dean gets her to the car. Straps her in.  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking...you should have some fun tonight1 Don't you think?  FRANKIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy listens in the front seat. She doesn't approve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens to a grandpa in shorts and a bathrobe wear navy scuba gear, JERRY HELLER - early 70's. He has a tube under his nose attached to an oxygen tank. His porch and front yard are overloaded with Fourth of July decorations  FRANKIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry growls at Frankie. She screams, scared but delighte yapping dog named SAMMY jumps on her. Jerry nods at Dean keeps his distance by the van.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you coming up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean gives a sour look and lights a cigarette.   (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 9A. 13 CONTINUED: 13   CINDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's an old man.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I can't smoke around his oxygen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy gives Dean a slow look of contempt, grabs the backp and walks toward the house. Jerry stands over the hose sp with Frankie at his side.  JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Want me to show you a magic trick? Here's how you turn the grass green. You can teach it to your dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sprinkler jets on. Cindy comes up and kisses her dad the cheek. She straightens Frankie's ears.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go say goodbye to Daddy. You're not going to see him until tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry holds Frankie back.     (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 10. 13 CONTINUED: (2) 13   JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait...! OK...one, two, three GO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie runs to Dean, dodging the water stream. She hugs leg. He picks her up.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey leopard. You be good now. You remember what to do when Pa snores?  FRANKIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cover his mouth and hold his nose.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my girl. Gimme a squeezer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean hugs her and she squeezes back as hard as her arms allow. Dean plays as if his neck was being pinched off. H sets her on the ground running back to the porch. She get caught in the diameter of the sprinkler spray. She scream the water chases her.  JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It got you! Go right! OTHER RIGHT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean and Cindy both laugh. Their eyes meet for the first in days, maybe weeks. They exchange a brief smile, filled with mutual love, pride and respect - connected by their little girl. Frankie stands in front of Cindy, water drip from her bangs.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on silly. Let's go in and get dry.  FRANKIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna take off my costume!  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to. Let's just go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy leads Frankie with one hand and pulls Jerry's oxyge tank with the other. Jerry takes Frankie's free hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean smokes and watches... Cindy hold the screen open wit her foot and maneuver father, tank and child inside. The screen door closes. Sammy barks at Dean through the scree door. He tugs his smoke, memories flood. He drifts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of barking. A YOUNGER DEAN, 24, walks 10 dogs. Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean comes inside from the cold. He tries to walk in quie not disturbing Jake who's watching TV in the back bedroom goes to say "hi" but decides he'd rather not disturb him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean sits on the couch which he uses as a bed. He pulls h travelling bag from underneath the coffee table, digs aro for a long sock where he keeps his money. He stuffs his d pay ($45), in the sock with the rest of his $ (about $100

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the kitchen, he opens the fridge. There is a pie tin w one last slice of pumpkin pie. Walks to Jake's room. Stan in the doorway. Jake doesn't acknowledge him.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man... Can I have a slice of that pie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dog poops on the sidewalk. Dean gets his little bag rea Sees - a light post with flyers taped to it. Dean reads - WANTED-$22/hr. He tears it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean waits for the bus to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean enters, hair combed, still wet, with fresh teeth mar JO - 36, receptionist sits beyond a scratched window. Dea pulls out the folded flyer and asks if they have any work  JO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna have to speak with Mr. Saned, honey. Wait just a minute, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean sits on a chair, smooths his hair, smells his clothe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saned - huge hands, the boss - leads Dean through a large open garage, lined with many sizes of moving trucks.  SANED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normally we are busiest at the beginning of the month. You break your back for two weeks, you get 2 weeks to rest. That's normal. Days start early. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 12. 19 CONTINUED: 19

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll work on a crew of 4. The rate for 4 men is $122/hour.$40 goes to the truck. You split the rest. Plus tips. Policy on tardiness; you work for the day you don't get paid. You're late two times; don't bother coming back. Any questions, talk to Curtis. He's your supervisor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WORKERS eye Dean. He introduces himself. Shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean rides in the back of a 20 foot truck. The wind is co He warms his hands with his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean lifts two large boxes and moves toward the stairs.  CURTIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa whoa. You gonna break your neck homey. Look down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean does. All he sees is brown box.  CURTIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't see your feet. If you can't see your feet, how you gonna know where the step is? You goin' bust your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis takes the boxes from Dean and demonstrates.  CURTIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis hefts the boxes on Dean's back. He pulls his arms around the back to hold onto them in an awkward position.  CURTIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be a mule. Always carry on your back. Give `er a try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean is unsure. He proceeds, imbalanced down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes it to the truck where Saned waits to help him ge the boxes in. Dean can't quite manage a 30-pound, behind back hand-off. He ends up spilling up the boxes and their contents all over the sidewalk. Saned gets pissed. Dean g down on his hands and knees and packs up the boxes - quic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Dean puts $300 in an envelope, seals it, and writes "TH PAL." He slides the envelope under Jake's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - He lays on the couch, wrapped up in a white sheet, smok a cigarette. Tries to stretch his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUNCH-TIME. Dean, Curtis sit in the bed of the truck, leg dangling. They eat hamburgers and talk about girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean showers, tries to stretch his aching back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fifty something MAN helps an ELDERLY MAN navigate his walker down the stairs of his neglected Brownstone. Dean holds a ream of unfolded cardboard boxes and can't help b stare. Curtis slaps him on the back.  CURTIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna happen to you someday too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Cindy pukes in the toilet.     (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 40. 81 CONTINUED: 81

dialogues.speaker: DEAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...And you have all these ideas in your head about how you'll act and what you'll say and what you'll do, who you'll be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She washes the taste out of her mouth and looks at hersel the mirror. She flicks water at her reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean sweeps the bed of the truck. The broom catches somet in the corner. Dean reaches - a locket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEAN (V.O.) cont'd ...And then the opportunity comes, it presents itself to you, living and breathing in the flesh, and you puss out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean holds up the locket and stares at it, twirling. He o the latch - sees a picture of the old man and his wife - years ago. Dean puts it in his pocket, finishes sweeping

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. TRAIN/TRAIN STATION. AFTERNOON. 6 YEARS EARLIER
Unknown
dialogues.text: Still wearing his work clothes, Dean rides the train out the city, pulls out the locket. Reads the inscription on back - "you are my sunshine."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean gets off the train. Asks some people for directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A feeling of anticipation. Dean pulls the lever - his sto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean walks to the old man's room. The door is open, light are off, room is empty. All the furniture, pictures, gone just an empty bed. Dean is at a loss for what to do. He h the TV coming from across the hall. He knocks, waits, the opens Cindy's Gramma's door. She is lying in bed. Tries t recognize Dean. He pulls up a chair next to her.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I was looking for your neighbor... the man who moved in last month. Across the hall. Do you know what happened to him?  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 41. 86 CONTINUED: 86   GRAMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went out for groceries.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the girl that was with you?  GRAMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conversation moves in circles. Not much information i gained. Dean ends up just holding her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus drives away. Inside, Dean stands. He is a little down. He feels around in his pocket. Finds the locket. He puts it on. The bus comes to a stop. A few passengers get One of them is Cindy. Dean watches her pay her fare and m to the back of the bus without noticing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finds a seat, pulls her hoodie low, anonymous. She underlines passages from a textbook using a highlighter. is frozen. He gathers the courage to walk toward her. The moving bus throws his balance. He stands over her for a moment. Cindy senses somebody in her space. She looks up. Recognizes him, but can't place it.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just had a long talk with your gramma... is that, is that your gramma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy remembers him now - he's just dressed nicer - he doesn't look like a mover  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was looking for that old guy who moved across the hall, you know? Do you know what happened to him?     (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 42. 87 CONTINUED: 87   CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he passed away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean feels for the locket around his neck. He shakes his head.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's exactly what happened to my dog. My parents moved out of our house and three days later she was a goner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls the locket out from behind his shirt. He unclasp it. Shows her the pictures.  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was so handsome, wasn't he? I was trying to give it back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy looks at it.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was pretty too..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean thinks about the old man. The bus drives.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She must have been crazy.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you say that?  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause there's one thing I know... the prettier a girl is the more nuts she is. I mean, look at you... you must be insane.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, I mean, I get it. It's not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy pulls the chain to stop the bus.  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus slows. She gets up to leave. Doors open.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 42A. 87 CONTINUED: (2) 87   DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I walk with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy thinks about it.  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for a little bit... And when you don't want to walk with me no more, then just speed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doors to the bus open. Cindy thinks about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean and Cindy wander side by side down the sidewalks and streets of the town. They walk and talk about - small tow and big cities, school and work, dreams and nightmares, b old and being young, etc.     (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 43. 88 CONTINUED: 88   DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's you house?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We passed it.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean looks back. He sees a bunch of houses that all look same. They keep walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLIPSE: Cindy smokes one of Dean's cigarettes, calls her A89 A89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on a pay phone and tells him she won't be home for dinner because she is studying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLIPSE. DEAN tells Cindy about his childhood, the B89 B89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sexualizing of his mother, and his fascination with women purses. It makes Cindy a little uncomfortable.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think it would be okay if I looked in your purse?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy thinks about it for a moment. Against her better judgement, she hands over her bag. It weighs a lot.  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez... What you got in here?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Books. Mostly.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lot of books. You doing good?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna be when you grow up?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to get into med school.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 44. 88 CONTINUED: (2) 88   DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to be a doctor?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someday.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? What should I do about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pretends to bump into a pole. Cindy laughs.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEAN (rubbing his head) You're gonna be a good doctor. I can tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He digs through text books, pens, a wallet, asthma inhale Then he comes to a bottle of lotion. Opens the cap, sniff  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm. This is what you smell like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy nods, "I guess so."  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna smell like you. Can I?  CINDY

dialogues.text: You wanna put on my lotion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean nods, applies a little lotion to his fingertips, rub in circles on his hands, applies it to his forearms, neck face. He enjoys the feeling of it, offers her some. She s no. He digs through her purse and finds lip balm, smells  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what your lips smell like? They must smell good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts some on his lips.  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm. Your lips must taste good.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you fucking with me?  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 45.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN FINDS A LITTLE BAG INSIDE THE PURSE. SHE SNATCHES IT
dialogues.text: 89 89  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in there?

dialogues.text: She takes her purse back.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay enough...  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throughout the rest of the night Dean tries to continuall steal Cindy's purse from her. It is a game. Innocent.

dialogues.text: 90 90  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you gonna miss your train?  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably. I think I... I think I already did. It's okay. There's an early one.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are just gonna stay up all night?  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until you get tired...

dialogues.speaker: ELLIPSE
dialogues.text: 91 91  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you grow up?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy gives him a grimace.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same streets. Same people. Everything here is the same. You walk down the street, you can't get lost... you know. . (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 46. 91 CONTINUED: 91   DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you want to go? I mean, if you could go anywhere..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk to an old playground. Cindy gets an idea.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy runs to an old, creaky merry-go round, jumps on.  CINDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to love these things.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God... I hate these things.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean is tentative, but goes along with her. He starts slo but she eggs him to go faster. He runs in circles picking speed until he is in a breathless, circular sprint. He ca keep up with the centrifugal force.  CINDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean does as he's told. They both hold on for dear life. world spins in a frenzy. The dread on Dean's face builds insane laughter. It is super fun. Cindy screams. Her hair snaps in her face. Then, a look of sickness steals her sm away. She wants it to stop, which, slowly, it does. She g off first, tries to walk, but is too dizzy. She just keep falling to the ground. Dean crawls off the merry-go round all fours, laughing.     (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 47. 91 CONTINUED: (2) 91   DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened, tough guy?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it stop.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta puke... it's the only way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She refuses.  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only way. It will make you feel better. Don't be embarrassed. I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sticks his finger down his throat and forces himself t vomit. The sound of it is too much for her. She gags. Sid side, they puke into the gravel. They finish their busine and end up on their backs and out of breath, side by side looking up at the stars. They are both covered in sweat. see their breath.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still spinning.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's just the Earth that's spinning.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. We're flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh. Birds begin to awaken and fly.  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should come visit me in the city sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The morning air chills their bodies. Dean takes off his jacket and uses it as a blanket. They get close together get warm and watch the stars spin above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dining room table is set for two. A single champagne  glass is raised.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To honesty...  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 48. 92 CONTINUED: 92

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit across from each other. Cindy drinks premature.  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Wait up.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're toasting tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean makes his toast. CLINK. Dean quaffs his glass.  CINDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes you don't make any sense. You might as well be speaking Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean imitates a Chinese man - it goes on too long.  CINDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy belated anniversary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy starts to eat a spread of Indian food and booze.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is it?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. How did Frankie sound?   DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. She's the best.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't sound sad?  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw. She's the champ. She's the best parts of you and the best parts of me put together. Everyday she gets more and more amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean chews a bite of meat and washes it down with a shot vodka. He refills both their glasses.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy's little girl.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not mine. I'm hers.     (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 49. 92 CONTINUED: (2) 92

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy slows down.  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm her father. She isn't there for me... I'm there for her. That's the way I look at it.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's beautiful.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the choice I made when she was born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. They chew. Cindy stares through Dean.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you do something...  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... isn't there anything you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean thinks about it. Shakes his head.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to want to do?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... You have so many things you could do. You're good at everything. You could do anything you wanted.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanna be with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Cindy tries not to look disappointed.  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like an animal right now. Your eyes look like an animal. Like a bear's eyes.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like right before the bear eats the man?  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... You do. It's true. That's what you look like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean is amused but fearful. Cindy's confidence surges.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 50. 92 CONTINUED: (3) 92   DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatchu thinking about?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How different we are. You and me.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a good thing.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that's good that we're different?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. We don't have to get in each other's way.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's the way you like it, don't you? You don't like me to bother you.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that. What I meant is that it's important for us to have our space. That's all. We're grown people.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well there's not much space here. So I guess you won't be able to get away from me will ya?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, we rarely sit down and have a conversation. An adult conversation. Because every time we do, you turn something that I say around and make it mean something that I didn't mean to say. You just blab. Blab.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're not interested in hearing what I think I just won't say anything.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck. I just want you to think about what you say sometimes instead of saying what you think all the time.     (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 51. 92 CONTINUED: (4) 92   DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. I'm going to say something. And what I'm about to say I've thought long and hard about. I'm the luckiest person alive because I'm living my dream - you, her, this, us, all of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy lifts up her empty wine glass to the light.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think my glass has a hole in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy cuts around her food and pushes a piece aside.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with that?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fat.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the flavor. Eat it.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to. You eat it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean stabs a piece of fat and pops it into his mouth.  CINDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's going straight to your tits.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My tits? I got tits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean opens his shirt and peers down at his chest.   DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could still kick yer ass.     (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 52. 92 CONTINUED: (5) 92   CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shiiit. I bet you a nickel you can't even beat me at arm wrestling.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dime and you're on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy gulps more champagne. They scoot dishes out of the and clasp hands in the middle of the table.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm always ready, baby.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the count of three... One... Two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy flexes and starts.  CINDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean, acting as if he isn't trying at all, holds Cindy's at a stand still.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Go! Start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy ignores his taunts and pushes as hard as she can. Slowly, she begins to push Dean's hand down. Dean groans, letting her win a little. Cindy presses down with all her weight. His hand is centimeters from hitting the table. T he turns the tide. Cindy battles back with all the streng she can muster. Dean laughs, realizing her passion for victory. Dean pounds her hand into the table. He stands kisses his flexed bicep. Cindy lifts her hand. A fork is  stuck in the back of it. She looks at it with curiosity.  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh fuck.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm alright.     (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 53. 92 CONTINUED: (6) 92   DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He plucks the fork from her hand, leaving four vampire bi  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow ow ow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean leads her to the kitchen, holds her hand under the faucet.   DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think we should rush you to the hospital before you bleed to death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy shoots him a look. Dean wraps her hand with a dishr  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it hurt?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It stings a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean tries to pick up Cindy. She struggles against it. Finally he cradles her like a squirming baby.  CINDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no... Put me down. It's okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean huffs a little. Cindy adjusts her weight, self- conscious. He hefts her down the hallway to the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean awkwardly sets Cindy down on the circular spaceship  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait wait wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flicks the switch and the bed starts spinning. He runs of the room. Cindy watches the room around her spin. Dean returns with the vodka bottle and two shot glasses. He kn above her and pours them two shots.     (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 54. 93 CONTINUED: 93   DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To numb the pain. Doctors orders. I'm an anesthesiologist.   CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm spinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits up. They toast. Dean gulps his. Cindy takes a si  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink up. We haven't gotten loaded together in years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tops off her glass, refills his own, and quaffs it.   DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta take a piss. Don't fall asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her on the forehead, stumbles. Cindy hears Dean urinating. She is sickened by it. She tries to set her fu glass on the floor that spins beneath her. The toilet flushes. The drink tips over. A loud crash comes from the BATHROOM. Cindy sits up.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
