So he squeezes through the receptionist window, f underneath the desk for the door release button. Tony yan on the door. The door buzzes open and the gang, Bobby in lead, rush into the cacophonous garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy presses the telephone to her ear - waiting... Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean is all alone in the garage, loading up a truck with reams of cardboard boxes for a big job tomorrow. Bobby an gang search through a maze of yellow trucks.  BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey faggot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean continues his work.  BOBBY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your name Dean?  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's askin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby rushes him, throws a shoulder into his stomach. The both flail to the floor. The two lock. Everything is quic Bobby sends a flurry of punches to Dean's ribs and guts. pummels the back of Bobby's head with blind overhead righ It becomes clear that Bobby has the upper hand. He holds Dean's bloodied head in some kind of jiujitsu headlock.  BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think I'm dumb? Think I'm that dumb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean struggles to breathe but manages to say...  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're a fucking idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby hits him again, harder. Harder.  BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking faggot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Troy and Tony watch the door and egg Bobby on. - THE PH RINGS OFF THE HOOK in the EMPTY OFFICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy's mind is taking her to bad places. She hangs up. T herself that everything is all right. Paces her room... P up the phone and dials again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy whistles sharp, warning Bobby that Jo has just arriv Bobby kicks Dean while he's down. Dean is beat and Bobby running out of breath and strength.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 69. 120 CONTINUED: 120   BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away from her!  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby looks at his bloodied hands. He lacks the strength lift he arms. Gives one last weak kick into Dean's bloodi face. Troy and Tony pull Bobby out. The gang leaves, victorious yet somehow defeated. The office phone, which been ringing incessantly, stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean is on the floor in the fetal position. It takes him while, but he manages to sit up. He feels the inside of h split lip with his tongue. He doesn't feel pain as much a feels tingling and ringing - all over. Jo comes in. She freezes when she sees him.  JO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean... Telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes Dean a while to get up, but he does. And it take him a while to get to the office where his phone call awa Once there, he holds the receiver in his hand for a beat.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy wearing scrubs, picks up the ringing phone.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mediplex... You are going to need to come in... We're going to need to see him... I can't diagnose over the phone... About 20- 30 minutes... Okay? ...okay, bye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy hangs up. She holds a clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CINDY (reading) (cont'd) Maria?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Hispanic women, MARIA GUEVARA - robust, 50's - clutches purse and rises off a waiting area chair. Cindy smiles.  CINDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy opens the door and gestures to the examination tabl  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 70. 122 CONTINUED: 122   CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a seat on the table, Mrs. Guevara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria has a blank look.  CINDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you speak English? Hablas Ingles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria holds her fingers up, indicating an inch.  MARIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poquito?  MARIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo tabien. De donde eres tu?  MARIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El Salvador.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...Tu famalia esta aqui? Here?  MARIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in El Salvador?  MARIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si....Yo...sola. How you say en Ingles? Sola?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...Sola...Alone.  MARIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si. Alone.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But hopefully not lonely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria hides her face with her hand and lets out a self- pitying giggle. Cindy looks at her clipboard.  CINDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're feeling some pain in your left breast. Uh...Tu dueles en tu chiche?  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 71. 122 CONTINUED: (2) 122   MARIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si Si.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well let's take a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy hands her a paper robe.  CINDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you take off tu ropas and pongas... put this on? Okay? Comprende?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria nods and takes the robe. Cindy turns to leave.  CINDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lo siento mi Espanol es muy mal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy leaves the room and gets a drink of water from the fountain. Dr. Feinberg approaches her from behind.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FEINBERG
dialogues.text: Busy. Haven't sat down yet. Walk with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy's holds her clipboard to her chest. He tilts it dow with his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. FEINBERG (cont'd) What do you have?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman in 215. Hispanic. 53. Lives alone. Complaining of pain in her left breast.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FEINBERG
dialogues.text: Uh huh. I'll be in in a minute. By the way, I was thinking about you.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: DR. FEINBERG
dialogues.text: Yeah, well I can understand how you might not be able to relocate your whole family up to Riverdale, with your daughter being in school and everything. But, I was thinking, maybe, you could get an apartment. Work during the week, drive down on weekends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at a door, Room 220. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 72. 123 CONTINUED: 123

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. FEINBERG (cont'd) You wouldn't have to worry about being alone... We could hang out together. Grab some dinners sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy blushes and then her brow furrows.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm married.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FEINBERG
dialogues.text: It's not a proposition, I'm just trying to help.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember asking you for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up his hands and leaves Cindy alone in the hallw She looks at the ground, turns around and walks to Room 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria sits, still clothed, on the table clutching the rob Cindy walks into the room and looks at her.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem, Maria? Tu sabes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy pantomimes undoing her shirt.  CINDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No comprende? Necessita take off tu comisitas. Your shirt. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria nods and undoes her blouse. Cindy turns her back. M sits slumped with her blouse opened. Cindy pantomimes removing her shirt fully. Maria does so and sits with her hand covering her face. Cindy gestures to her bra.  CINDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Por favor, Maria. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria unhooks her bra. A purplish cantaloupe-size abscess grows on her left breast. Cindy's covers her mouth.  CINDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Jesus Christ. Maria...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria puts back on her blouse.     (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 73. 124 CONTINUED: 124   CINDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria! Que eso? Why didn't you come in sooner? Why did you wait this long?! Eso es muy mal. Very bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria starts to cry.  CINDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you look at yourself in the mirror and pretend it's not there? How long have you been pretending?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Feinberg walks into the room.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FEINBERG
dialogues.text: Cindy. What's going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy points to Maria.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her breast. Her breast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Feinberg takes Cindy's clipboard from her hands.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FEINBERG
dialogues.text: I can take over from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He talks to Maria calm and clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. FEINBERG (cont'd) Hello Mrs. Guevara. I'm Dr. Feinberg. I'm your DOCTOR. Let me see. It's OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for the trembling Maria's blouse. Maria flinch  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's probably been growing for years!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Feinberg turns to Cindy.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FEINBERG
dialogues.text: Out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to Maria and places his hand on her shoulde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. FEINBERG (cont'd) It's going to be alright, Mrs. Guevara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy backs out of the room. Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean gets out of the Aspen. The kids honk as they drive o Drunk and stoned, he walks to the entrance of the clinic carrying their suitcases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean walks through the lobby and approaches Mimi at the reception desk. He drops his baggage.  MIMI (ON PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am you're going to have to bring him in...you have to bring him in...  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him an in-patient form. Dean looks at it.  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mimi cups her hand over the phone.  MIMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to fill that out, sir. You can go over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mimi returns to the phone.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing wrong with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean hands her back the clipboard.  MIMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you need to fill it out, sir. Bring it back up to me when you're done.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mimi lowers the phone.  MIMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's your wife?  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia. Where is she?   (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 75. 126 CONTINUED: 126   MIMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Dean?  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, are you deaf or are you just dumb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts the phone on hold and disappears into the clinic Dean turns around and looks at the people in the waiting room. He has a slight confrontation with a gang banger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy approaches from the hallway.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean?  DEAN (TURNS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saved you a trip.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that. How'd you get here?  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mimi appears behind Cindy.  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - I was going out of my mind. I didn't know if there's an emergency. I didn't know if Francis was hurt. Did you think about that?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie's fine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean nods. He looks over Cindy's shoulder at Mimi.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking pictures?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mimi sits down at her desk and picks up a ringing phone.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going to do this here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy crosses the counter, grabs the bags by Dean's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CINDY (to Mimi) (cont'd) Give me a few minutes.  MIMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right here. Don't let him brainwash you again.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 76. 126 CONTINUED: (2) 126   CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Live your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy walks out of the clinic hefting her bags.  CINDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean grabs the remaining luggage and follows, throwing ba look to both Mimi and the Gang-banger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean follows behind Cindy.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night got fucked up, OK? I know it. I know I'm lazy, I eat too much, I drink too much, I drive you crazy with all my jealous bullshit. I fuck up. I know I'm clumsy. But you're not trying anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy hurls the bags into the back of the car. Dean helps  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't make me be alone.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you drunk?  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm OK.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you drive?  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Let's go.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you go. Take the car home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him the keys.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think about anyone but yourself. Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy walks back to the clinic. Dean follows close behind  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got no time for me anymore. It all goes to this fucking job. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 77. 127 CONTINUED: 127

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You give it all to them. All these people who don't give a shit about you. They get the beautiful version of you. What does your family get? Nothing. You come home and you're empty. You think I don't notice? You think Frankie doesn't notice? Her mom walking around like a ghost?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how many sacrifices I make every day.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! What about me? I gave up everything for you.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never asked you to! I can't take this shit anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy enters through the electric doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean follows Cindy down the hallway to the employee's lou  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take what? What can't you take... The truth? I know you can't... You never could.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right Dean, I can't take the truth...I've had it with the truth or whatever it is you make up along the way and label as truth... You win. I give up... I've been lying to you for a long time.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me, Dean. I didn't want to hurt you. But I'm not the person you fell in love with. And you won't let me be anything but that person. That's why I can't look at you. Because every time I do I can't stop thinking about how much I want you to hate me. But you're too stupid to see it, and too chicken shit to do anything about it.   (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 78. 128 CONTINUED: 128   DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her in a hug. Her arms are pressed into her side  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't love you anymore... Why can't you stop loving me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls back his fist and swings, hitting the metal lock behind Cindy's head. He repeats the blows with thunderous rage. Feinberg enters the room.  FEINBERG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean turns and takes a blind swing at Feinberg. One blow Feinberg reels against the metal lockers. He hits the gro with a thud. His nose gushes blood. Dean paces around Feinberg like a caged animal. He pulls down a locker with hand. It crashes to the floor. Cindy kneels over Feinberg  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'm sorry. Let me see.  FEINBERG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're done. Leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean jerks Cindy up off the floor.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hits Dean with a flurry of flailing fists.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Punches catch him in the nose. Cindy bullies Dean backwar with repeated shoves to the chest. He backs up down the hallway. Mimi stands in the hallway.  MIMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god. Call 911. I'm going to call 911.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors slide open and Dean backs outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 129 129  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the keys.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 79. 129 CONTINUED: 129

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She digs into his pocket and fishes them out. She marches the car, gets in the driver's seat, starts the car - the radio blasts at high decibels. Dean bangs on the passenge side window. Cindy flips the lock. Dean gets in the car.  CINDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a divorce!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has emptied herself. Her whole body is numb and it fe as if she is floating in space. Anger overcomes Dean. He the dashboard with concrete fists.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the suitcase next to him and opens the door. He throws it through the air into a FIELD - trying rid himse of pain, longing, and desperation. He clutches his weddin ring, but can't yank it off of his fat finger. Finally, h gets it off and tosses it into the field. The moment he releases it, he wishes he hadn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOMENTS LATER - Dean and Cindy search for the ring. It is lost. Music begins to play in reverse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various Scenes of the Periera family together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All kinds of flowers. Colors, smells. Freshly arranged. D studies them. Finds the one's he likes. And steals them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Dean from behind - walking down the middle of t street. He holds the flowers. Meanwhile, we hear Cindy as her gramma questions about love and life. "What's it like be old?" - "when did men stop looking at you?" She confid her feelings for Dean. (The responses will be real respon a real conversation).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy and Gramma sit at the dinner table. The sound of boiling. Steam rises out of the pots and pans. They conti their conversation. Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean finds the house. He straightens himself, walks to th front door, rings the BELL, checks the smell of his hands

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry, bourbon in hand, opens the door. Dean's face is pu and swollen from the fight.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know if it was pot luck so I brought an eggplant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points at his face. Behind Jerry, Cindy peeks out from kitchen at the end of the hallway. It is the first time s has seen Dean since the fight. She is shocked.  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face looks like an eggplant, don't it? How you doing sir, I'm Dean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean holds out his hand. Jerry looks Dean up and down.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy squeezes by her father to Dean. The expression on h face says it all. Dean hands her the flowers, leans in an kisses her. While he's there he whispers.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stole these for you.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean nods. She leads him down the hall. Jerry stops, turn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JERRY (to Cindy) Tell him to take off his shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean removes his boots. A toe wiggles out of a holey sock gathers the hole and tucks it between his big toe and his second toe. Cindy leads him by the hand to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Heller family and Dean sit around the table. Jerry, Glenda and Gramma bow their heads, saying grace.

dialogues.speaker: ALL EXCEPT DEAN
dialogues.text: Come lord Jesus, be our guest, and let thy gifts to us be blessed. Amen.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 81. 135 CONTINUED: 135

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glenda continues with a little speech about choices, and needing to be able to make mistakes with our choices. Her speech continues over the next images...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - They eat. Dean compliments the meal. Glenda is self depreciating. Jerry is judgemental. Gramma wants to go ho Cindy can't take her eyes off of Dean - she has fallen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER - Cindy leads Dean upstairs to her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean follows, obediently. Cindy closes her door behind hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins gently kissing Dean's wounds. Whispers.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that hurt.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It feels good. Keep doing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does and is interrupted by... The FAINT SOUND of her parents fighting downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: ...She's going to struggle the rest of her Goddamn life with that fucking loser. And that's okay with you. Sit there...sit there on your fat ass don't do a goddamn thing.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should go.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? They'll stop soon.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to miss my train.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy goes over to her stereo and turns on some music, lo it is the same song that Dean and Cindy listened to in th moon room. It drowns out some of the fighting. She approa him, starts unbuttoning his shirt.  CINDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me one thing... you'll never let me become an adult.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 82. 136 CONTINUED: 136   DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him. Opens up his shirt. Reveals a severely bruised torso. He winces a bit from the movement. She redresses his wounds, nursing him back to health.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses his chest. Dean starts getting underneath Cind clothes. He places his palm on her belly.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From here on out, their actions increase with urgency. Ea moment that goes by makes them more and more desperate to feel the other's skin. They are down to their underwear w they hear a door slam downstairs.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are your parent's gonna walk in on us?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They never come in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They make sweet love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door bursts open and Frankie, still in her leop costume, charges down the walkway.  FRANKIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy! Daddy! Mommy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy's car sits in the driveway. Cindy gets out, grabs h suitcase. Jerry emerges from the house. Cindy kneels down hugs Frankie. She is electricity in her arms.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who had candy for breakfast? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 83. 137 CONTINUED: 137

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie doesn't answer and squirms out of Cindy's arms. S runs to Dean who gets out of the car like a wounded soldi  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie leaps into Dean's arms. Cindy walks up to the hou  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was Frankie?  JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was good. Are you OK?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy kisses her father on the cheek, closes the screen d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEAN (holding Frankie) I can't play right now, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He releases his wired daughter who runs circles around hi Dean walks up to the porch. He and Jerry stand face to fa  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to get out of my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry backs away. Dean walks past him into the house.  JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what happened up there. But please Dean, come on. Don't push it. Let it be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean closes the screen door behind him and locks it. Jerr pulls on the door.  JERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! You can't lock me out of my own house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean calls back.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep an eye on Francis.  JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have my oxygen! Hey! Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy puts on a simple yellow dress. She checks herself i the mirror. Her hand traces the bump on her belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy pours a glass of water. She gulps down aspirin. Dea keeps his distance at the edge of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the backyard, Frankie makes herself dizzy by twirling. Jerry cranes his neck to look into the window of his hous  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not coming home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear strikes Dean. He presses the base of his palms into eyes, rubbing until he sees stars.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not alone here Cynthia. We have a little girl. We need to think about her.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am thinking about her.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you're thinking about is yourself. You. Francis is gonna grow up in a broken home and that's OK with you.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let her grow up in a home where her parents don't love each other.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't love each other? I've only ever loved you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean approaches her from behind. Reaches out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean wears his baby blue tux. He looks himself up and dow the mirror. Takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy flinches from Dean's touch. A look of terror in her eyes. Dean hushes her. He leads her to a chair and sits h down. He kneels by her side and repeats her name.  (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 85. 141 CONTINUED: 141   DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Cynthia...Cynthia...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds her hands and gropes her arms, legs, shoulders whatever she will let him touch. Cindy has tears in her e but she is focused. There is nothing to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean takes a quarter, places it in a gumball machine, tur the crank. A plastic box rolls out. He takes it, shakes i inside is a plastic ring. She takes a quarter and follows suit, buying another plastic ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In THE KITCHEN, Frankie climbs in through the old dog doo She sees her father kneeling on the floor at her mother's feet. Perplexed, she pulls at her bottom lip with her fin Cindy releases herself from Dean's grip and goes to her suitcase. She carries it up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean and Cindy wait together in a room filled with other people about to get married. They observe these other peo and create fictional narratives about them and their live for each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy opens the door and sets her suitcase on the dusty b The room is just like it used to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean is defeated. He sits back against the cupboards and hangs his head down low between his knees. Frankie touche his shoulders. She gives him a massage.  FRANKIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to stay at Grampa's house next time for fifty nights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean looks up. He has tears in his eyes. Frankie touches as it streams down his face.  FRANKIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you crying?   (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 85A. 145 CONTINUED: 145

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean can't answer. Frankie slides a chair over to the sin She steps up and fills the glass with water. Balancing it still, she brings it to Dean. She takes a sip and hands t glass to him. He drinks.  DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you...     (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 86. 145 CONTINUED: (2) 145

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy comes down the stairs.  DEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy's gonna go now, OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean stands and picks up Frankie. He walks to Cindy and h her over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy and Dean stare into each other's eyes. The JUSTICE THE PEACE reads them their vows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie tries to squirm out of her mother's arms.  FRANKIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean walks out the front door where he passes Jerry who stands on the porch. He moves across the lawn to the sidewalk. Vermillion light falls in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy sets Frankie down and she runs out the door. Jerry catches the little girl by the arm and holds her tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean walks toward the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANKIE (SCREAMS) (cont'd) Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean stops and turns. Cindy walks to the porch.  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry releases her and Frankie runs fast to Dean. She jum at him to go into his arms. He doesn't pick her up. From porch Cindy and Jerry watch Dean as he points to them. Frankie doesn't move. Dean yells for her to go back. Fran heads back to her mother, confused. Cindy kneels down and takes her in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Families light fireworks off in the middle of the streets

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEAN continues down the street that connects with other streets, all lined with pretty houses.   (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 86A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The houses form neighborhoods that join with other neighborhoods forming towns. Beyond the towns, hills stre far into to the horizon. Fireworks explode against dark b on blue.      (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Valentine Official Green Script as of 6/9/09 87. 148 CONTINUED: (2) 148

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean and Cindy consecrate their vows. The ceremony lasts of 45 seconds.  JUSTICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... you may now kiss the bride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean and Cindy kiss. We hold on the kiss for as long as i takes. They stop kissing and look at each other in the ey Then, they start to hug. And hug... and hug...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The title BLUE VALENTINE superimposes on top of the image Credits start to scroll over...

dialogues.speaker: A SERIES OF PORTRAITS/DOCUMENTS OF MARRIAGES. REAL PEOPLE
